key_risks: Regulatory and legal challenges, including significant fines for AML compliance failures
Reputation and customer trust issues due to high fees and unfavorable exchange rates
Intense competition from fintech disruptors threatening market share
Declining relevance of physical agent network as digital transactions grow
controversies: $586 million settlement with U.S. Department of Justice and FTC for AML and consumer fraud violations
$184 million fine by FinCEN for AML violations
Involvement in fraud schemes leading to a $586 million settlement to compensate victims
social_issues: High fees and unfavorable exchange rates eroding customer loyalty
Low resolution rate for customer complaints (22%) raising concerns about service quality
governance_issues: Regulatory scrutiny and compliance failures in AML practices

sources.title: US fines Western Union for money laundering violations
sources.snippet: The US Treasury's Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) has fined money transfer company Western Union USD184 million for anti-money laundering (AML) compliance failures. Western Union is an international money transfer business, with 500,000 offices operating in 200 countries and territories.
